page.title: 04Bank Farm Welshampton
page.content: Bank Farm is a mixed farm.It has not been run by Mr and Mrs Halls family for generations only since 1955.The farm is 320 acres.It is very highly mechanised.Mr Hall employs 3 men for the work.They plant about 100 acres of barley.They have 130 milking cows and 130 heifers and calves.They start milking at quarter to 4 in the afternoon.The animal fodder is mostly home grown,things like hay,barley,silage and straw,but things like dairy nuts and concentrates are bought in.The cattle have the amount of feed depending on how much milk they give.They own 5 tractors.The farm house is 150 years old.Some people say it was built on a moat,because it has a big dip all around it.They have lots of wildlife around,but mainly rabbits,pheasants,partridges and duck.
